intro: Campanula decloetiana, commonly known as the Decloet's bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula decloetiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
